text: Except for when you get to elections, then you can't do that.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: So those are the first two levels.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: And that's, I wanna point out, not making people have an ID is kind of part of that, right?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Yeah, but the ID thing for me is it misses the true way that you exploit the system, which is what I was getting to, which was level three.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And I think this is the problem with our elections is that there is a nation state capability to monitor all election data real time.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: and a nation state capability to change the results real time.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And we've seen evidences of automation PID controls where that's happening across the country.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the problem with the auditability of the system now is
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Our answer for everything is let's get poll watchers to stand in line.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Let's get people to show up to the place.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: But you can't look inside the black box.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: It's happening at such a deeper level that that's child's play.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Yeah.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And so unless you're looking at material that gives you answers about how the machine is operating, you're absolutely in the dark.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And I've got a little quote here from the New York Times.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Smartmatic was a little-known firm with no experience in voting technology before it was chosen by the Venezuelan authorities to replace the country's election machinery ahead of a contentious referendum that confirmed Mr. Chavez as president in August 2004, so 20 years ago.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: These machines were designed for fraud.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: So my question when I wrote this article X number of years ago was, how do you take something that's designed for fraud and straighten it out to tell the truth?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: The only way that you're going to improve the current election system is to basically walk away from it.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: These are open systems.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And when people had confidence in U.S.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: elections over the past 180 years in America, we used primarily closed systems.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So you'd show up to a ballot location or a voting location, and they'd put out a paper poll book.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And you'd sign a piece of paper, and they'd check their voter rolls to make sure that you're a citizen and that you live here.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And they'd hand you a paper ballot.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, now you've got electronic poll books, and we're seeing people that don't even show up being checked in, inserted, a ballot is generated associated with that identity, and it's being cast in the system.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And this sounds to me like the most...
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: vulnerable area for AI to be inserted into.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Yeah, and AI, it looks like it's going to be the future as far as its presence everywhere.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So you have a closed system that's been opened up.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the other thing about those e-poll books, and we use them here in Las Cruces because we have voting convenience centers, is that it gives all of these ballot meals the metrics they need to stuff the ballot boxes because they actually have software that tells you how many ballots have gone out.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: How many have come back in?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And so you can say, okay, we've got way more Republican ballots coming in than Democrats.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: What's the difference?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, then you better start filling out your fraudulent ballots, deploying them at drop boxes.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the reason why that's relevant here is we found in our investigation, because we actually did eight audits throughout the state of New Mexico, including Dona Ana, we found 9,000 ballots with no chain of custody stuffed in ballot boxes.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And folks, just hang on for a second.

text: All right, folks, here with Dave Clements, and I've got another, and this is out of my essay that I wrote, Venezuelan Voting Machine.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: A New York Times article stated, "...the federal government is investigating takeover last year of a leading American manufacturer of electronic voting systems by a small software company linked to the leftist Venezuelan government of President Hugo Chavez."
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: The inquiry is focusing on the Venezuelan owners of the software company, the Smartmatic Corporation, trying to determine whether the government in Caracas had any control or influence over the firm's operation.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: And that's like a no-brainer that they did.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: But, Dave, I didn't see anybody else writing this because when I did research on it, I found all this stuff.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: I was protecting myself by quoting other people.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Other places like the New York Times.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Well, you wouldn't have seen it, Kelly.

text: And just fun fact, Smartmatic has headquarters in, I think, Boca, Florida.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Is it Boca Raton?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Boca Raton.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So they're there.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: But the reason why you didn't see anything is not for lack of people trying to alert the American people.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Mike Benz went on Tucker Carlson and he put out some statistics that were pretty shocking.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: If you spoke negatively in the seven months leading up to the November 3rd, 2020 election about early voting, mail-in ballots, or these machines, your posts were taken down.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: 22 million posts that was under those three categories were perched on Twitter alone.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So if you look at Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and if you kept at it, you'd get those strikes and you'd be deplatformed.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So there are people with millions of followers.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: that were purged along with President Trump.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So, I migrated to alternative social media- Rumble.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Pretty early on, yeah, rumble.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: But no matter where you go, it's like you run into these ceilings where you think that you're finding your groove, you're reaching people, and they've got their algorithms tuned in Facebook to make sure that people can't see your message.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, and that's one reason I left YouTube is they have this shadow banning that is bad.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: But talk to me now.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: It's been X number of years since this first occurred.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Where's the fight at now?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: What are we doing?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: I know you're an important spokesman in this.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Where are we at now in trying to get our voting back?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: I've maintained since day one that the only way you're going to get your voting voice back is at the local level.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And a lot of people look to the legislature to solve all the problems.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Let's pass a new law.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, the problem with that is in 2020, no one followed the law.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Under COVID, your Department of Health had more to say about how your elections were run than your local clerks.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And so if that's not an option, then people think, well, let's have a fancy lawsuit with the right magical remedy.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, I personally reviewed over 400 election fraud lawsuits related to 2020.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: 99% of them were dismissed for lack of standing.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Meaning they weren't even set up for merits hearings.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the cases that were set up for merits hearings, they only set for about an hour.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So there was a concerted effort on not getting to the truth.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And you might ask yourself, well, why is that?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, I can give you two answers.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: People that are part of your legislature appear on the ballot.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: That you vote on.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And if they investigate this, and it has all kinds of issues that spring forth, they're undercutting their own position.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Same thing with courts that show up on retention election ballots.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So there's a vested interest from everyone that's gotten through to this date to say, I don't want to look into these black boxes.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So that's part of the problem.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So where I focus people's attention is, there's only one person that certifies that black box for use in your backyard, and that's your clerk.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They do a logic and accuracy test about 42 days before an election.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And effectively, they rubber stamp it.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And they know nothing about these machines.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Without a vendor holding their hand, they have no idea if there's Bluetooth capability.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They have no idea whether there's chip modems affixed to there.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They have no idea how to analyze the records.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And so they should be held accountable before you put forth a product that is arguably defective.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: or facilitates fraud, they should have a level of expertise that they just don't have.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And then the other group that we try to hold accountable are the certifying canvassing boards.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: These are your county commissioners here that take a yes-no vote after an election that everything here is above board.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the way that they can communicate to we, the people, that everything is above board is by putting a blindfold over their eyes.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: and plugging their ears and tuning people out, or only giving them like three minutes to talk at these commission meetings.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And so the willful ignorance over elections from those that are tasked with certifying is so disgusting that you're finding people now that are willing to risk losing those positions.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We've got commissioners all over the country now that are saying, you know, I'm being –
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I'm being told that if I don't certify this election that I know is fraudulent, that I'm gonna be charged with a felony and arrested.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: That happened in Otero County, that happened in Mojave County, that happened in Nevada just two weeks ago.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, let me ask you this, when people are getting threatened like that, if they are sued, if they are prosecuted, is there a chance that their entire family will be ruined by this?
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Well, yeah, and we've seen people's families ruined.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I mean, myself included.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I can be adamant that I had five complaints, five investigations for merely commenting on election fraud.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: elections.

text: And at some point you get the memo, I'm not going to be challenging this type of case.

text: I mean, think about that.

text: So the legal profession's pretty good about
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We've analyzed in at least 1,000 different locations this thing called a cast vote record summary.

text: We're talking about election, systemic election fraud that is predictive and it's at the code level.

speaker: SPEAKER_18
